message.content: {"steps":[{"output":"\\(n \\log a_{n+1} = (n+1) \\log a_n\\)","explanation":"Given equation after taking the common logarithm on both sides."},{"output":"\\(\\frac{\\log a_{n+1}}{n+1} = \\frac{\\log a_n}{n} + \\text{(A)}\\)","explanation":"Dividing both sides by \\((n+1)\\)."},{"output":"\\(b_n = \\frac{\\log a_n}{n}\\)","explanation":"Defining \\(b_n\\) as given in the problem."},{"output":"\\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\text{(A)}\\)","explanation":"From the equation \\(\\frac{\\log a_{n+1}}{n+1} = \\frac{\\log a_n}{n} + \\text{(A)}\\), we have \\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\text{(A)}\\)."},{"output":"\\(b_1 = \\log 10 = 1\\)","explanation":"Given that \\(b_1 = \\log 10\\)."},{"output":"\\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\)","explanation":"Since \\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\text{(A)}\\), and \\(\\text{(A)} = \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\), we have \\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\)."},{"output":"\\(b_n = 1 + \\sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \\frac{1}{k(k+1)}\\)","explanation":"The sequence \\(b_n\\) is telescoping, so we sum \\(\\frac{1}{k(k+1)}\\) from \\(k=1\\) to \\(n-1\\)."},{"output":"\\(\\sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \\frac{1}{k(k+1)} = \\sum_{k=1}^{n-1} \\left( \\frac{1}{k} - \\frac{1}{k+1} \\right) = 1 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)","explanation":"The sum is telescoping, so it simplifies to \\(1 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)."},{"output":"\\(b_n = 1 + 1 - \\frac{1}{n} = 2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)","explanation":"Substituting the result of the telescoping sum into the expression for \\(b_n\\)."},{"output":"\\(\\text{(B)} = 2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)","explanation":"The expression for \\(b_n\\) is \\(2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\), which is \\(\\text{(B)}\\)."},{"output":"\\(f(n) = \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\)","explanation":"From the expression \\(b_{n+1} = b_n + \\text{(A)}\\), we have \\(\\text{(A)} = \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\), which is \\(f(n)\\)."},{"output":"\\(g(n) = 2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)","explanation":"From the expression for \\(b_n\\), we have \\(\\text{(B)} = 2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\), which is \\(g(n)\\)."},{"output":"\\(g(10) = 2 - \\frac{1}{10} = 1.9\\)","explanation":"Substituting \\(n = 10\\) into \\(g(n) = 2 - \\frac{1}{n}\\)."},{"output":"\\(f(4) = \\frac{1}{4 \\times 5} = \\frac{1}{20}\\)","explanation":"Substituting \\(n = 4\\) into \\(f(n) = \\frac{1}{n(n+1)}\\)."},{"output":"\\frac{g(10)}{f(4)} = \\frac{1.9}{\\frac{1}{20}} = 1.9 \\times 20 = 38\\)","explanation":"Calculating the ratio \\(\\frac{g(10)}{f(4)}\\)."}],"final_answer":"\\MC: boxed{1}"}
